definition: to look after the house/(of skill, ability) special/outstanding
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: The young Charlton's greatest strengths were his speed and body swerve.
sentences.chinese: 年轻时查尔顿的看家本领是快速的奔跑和身体变向。

sentences.english: As a result, most women are left to care for the home with little hope of a future.
sentences.chinese: 结果，女性只能留下来看家，前途一片渺茫。

sentences.english: They will care for the sick, collect the rubbish, guard homes and offices, and give directions on the street.
sentences.chinese: 它们会照顾病人，收集垃圾，看家护院，上街指路。

sentences.english: From my graduation, family in order to guard home he bought a dog to keep.
sentences.chinese: 从我毕业时，家人为了看家护院便买了一只狗来养。

sentences.english: She is still guarding my family.
The competition is very keen but I have an ace up my sleeve .
sentences.chinese: 竞争很激烈，但我有我的看家本领。

sentences.english: Each family all have the dog guard home, this is for over a thousand years tradition.
sentences.chinese: 家家都有狗看家护院，这是上千年来的传统。

sentences.english: The host looks after it carefully every day and Bingo helps to guard the house.
sentences.chinese: 它主人每天都悉心照顾它，而宾果也会每天帮忙看家。

sentences.english: The master raised a dog to guard his house.
Jet was also an efficient bug-zapper and a terrific "watchdog."
sentences.chinese: “喷气机”还是个灭虫能手和出色的“看家狗”。

sentences.english: The mastiff was generally used as a guard dog and is widely recognized as a particularly intelligent species.
sentences.chinese: 藏獒犬一般用来看家护院，也是很聪明的犬种。

sentences.english: I like dogs, 34, look after the house on the big German shepherds guarding the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢狗，就养三四条看家护院的大狼狗。

sentences.english: This local play has been the bread and butter of the troupe.
sentences.chinese: 这出地方剧目一直是这个剧团赖以为生的看家节目。

sentences.english: The sound of heavy footsteps awoke the watchdog.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的脚步声惊醒了看家豿。

sentences.english: The specialty of this restaurant, "Fare well, my concubine (stewed tortoise and hen)" is the most delicious dish under heaven.
sentences.chinese: 本餐馆看家菜“霸王别姬”堪称天下第一。

sentences.english: Moreover, petscan also look after the house and when there's no one at home.
sentences.chinese: 再者，当家里没人时，宠物也能看家护院。

definition: specialty/unique skill
(fig.) trump card
expert in/good at
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
oneself/one's own family
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
self-protection/to defend oneself
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
to save one's life/to survive
consummate skill/supreme feat/tour-de-force/stunt
empty-handed/unarmed/(painting, embroidery etc) without following a model/(abbr. for 空手道[kong1 shou3 dao4]) karate
familial property/belongings
not presentable/not fit to be seen in company
